Sylvia Plath's Journals

whose life' doesn't seem aavailable, processe in uniform,

callophane-wrapped blocks, like synthetic orange cheese:

James has the authentic, cave-aged, mold-ripened smess of

The real thing. And yet, not a man, not completely. Joan

seems young + then for him. At coffee this morning he

seemed restored, jovial. We talked of bulls + bullfights,

after the two movies - on Goya + bullighting - last night.

I borrowed James autobiography + finished it tonight:

750 pages, "The Unfinished Man" - about his experiences as

a conscientious objector during the war: desultory

beginning, here, there, Stockolm, Finland + all told about,

characters pos trayed, not actually moving + talling on

their own, but talked about, half-emerged, like a [...] of

flushed marble. And women: he seem to [...] from them -

his wife queerly in the background, diminuishing to

America, to divorse; his child evaporating. "A told-about"

love affair' with' a queer Finnish girl, death-oriented, who

commits suicide (was he to blame, partly? did it really

happen?) and a rather illuminating statement that

he ("like most men") believes that loving a woman

eternally isn't incompatible with leaving her: loving, leaving-

a lovely consunance. I don't see it: and my man doesn't,

The quiet of midnight settlesover Route q. Already it is

tomorrow + the days I cross off with such vicious glee,-

just as I toss, with premature eagerness, empty bottles

of wine + honey' into the waste basket be near +

clear of clogging half-full jais-are those of my youngness

+ my promise. I believe, whether in madness or in half-

truth that if I live' for a year with the two years of my

life + learning . at Camblerm age I can write + rewrite a

good novel. Ten times this 35 page chapter + rewriting +

rewriting'. Goal set: June 1959: a novel + book of

poems, I can not draw in James' drama: war, [...], parachute doprs, hospitals in trenhces - my womans
[...] is [...] psychic + aesthetic: love+ looki[?]
